normalize-opentype-css.title: Introducing Normalize-OpenType.css
normalize-opentype-css.author: kennethormandy
normalize-opentype-css.desc: OpenType features—language requirements, typographic niceties, ligatures, alternate figures, small caps—are often forgotten about on the web even when included in a font. I’m that will happen a little less often with Normalize-OpenType.css.

your-favourite-app-isnt-native.title: Your favourite app isn’t native
your-favourite-app-isnt-native.author: kennethormandy
your-favourite-app-isnt-native.desc: With this image, it’s clear that Instagram is a hybrid app. This is something we knew, but had difficulty proving. Something that, if you knew, might have made you think that Instagram was worse application than it was.

web-type-west.title: Web Type West
web-type-west.author: kennethormandy
web-type-west.desc: Web Type West was a one-day conference on web typography, at Emily Carr University of Art + Design, in Vancouver, BC. What follows is my cleaned-up live notes from the event.

static-draft-posts-with-harp.title: Static draft posts with Harp
static-draft-posts-with-harp.author: kennethormandy
static-draft-posts-with-harp.desc: I have a lot of bad ideas. Once—well, more than once—I excitedly wore this gaudy, lime green t-shirt, sporting some kind of mesh racing stripe through the middle. Tucking it into the matching shorts was what really made the outfit. Or, what about when I stayed up so late the night before school, I fell asleep on someone on the bus the next day? (Fine, that one happened again yesterday.)

harp-all-the-things.title: Harp all the things: silentrob.me
harp-all-the-things.author: rob_ellis
harp-all-the-things.desc: So I had this idea late last year, but this is going to be the year I see it though. My goal—simple, convert every site I made to a static Harp site.

no-more-config.title: If you’re writing configuration to manage your assets you’re doing it wrong.
no-more-config.author: rob_ellis
no-more-config.desc: I grew up writing HTML, CSS and JavaScript like everyone else, but each time I opened a blank text document and starred at the page the awkward feeling crept in. My pinky finger still cringes from holding shift followed by <. Sure I could copy and paste in a template or use the HTML5 boilerplate, but that only saves keystrokes and does not make anything easier.

projct-hub.title: Project Hub: A new Harp template to track project timelines
projct-hub.author: jorgepedret
projct-hub.desc: A new Harp template that serves as a centralized home base for your projects and makes it really easily keep track of events and notes from the whole team.

lazily-live-blogging-rubyconf-argentina-.title: Live blogging RubyConf Argentina 2013
lazily-live-blogging-rubyconf-argentina-.author: sintaxi
lazily-live-blogging-rubyconf-argentina-.desc: I'm collecting my photographs of RubyConf Argentina 2013. This will be incomplete, things will be missed, but it's something. More pictures can be found on Flickr.

harp-platform-public-milestone-complete.title: Harp Platform public milestone complete
harp-platform-public-milestone-complete.author: jorgepedret
harp-platform-public-milestone-complete.desc: It’s been a whole year since I started working on the Harp Platform and we’re really excited to announce today that we’ve opened the gates to the public.

harp-platform-is-now-public.title: Harp Platform is now Public!
harp-platform-is-now-public.author: sintaxi
harp-platform-is-now-public.desc: After a successful private beta I am happy to announce the Harp Platform is now available to the public.

the-awkward-css-learning-curve.title: The Awkward CSS Learning Curve
the-awkward-css-learning-curve.author: jorgepedret
the-awkward-css-learning-curve.desc: When I started working with CSS, it wasn’t more than adding a couple of in-line styles to my beautiful HMTL table layout

dynamic-sitemap-for-your-harp-apps.title: Dynamic sitemap for your Harp Apps
dynamic-sitemap-for-your-harp-apps.author: jorgepedret
dynamic-sitemap-for-your-harp-apps.desc: Kevin Saliou asked last week about how to generate a dynamic sitemap of your Harp App. Here’s what we came up with.

start-a-blog-with-harp.title: Start a blog with Harp
start-a-blog-with-harp.author: kennethormandy
start-a-blog-with-harp.desc: I’ve always enjoyed pretending to be a developer. Faking my way through new web technologies has become a familiar exercise. But this time was different: the deception didn’t come from me, but my own development environment.

introducing-harp.title: Introducing Harp
introducing-harp.author: sintaxi
introducing-harp.desc: After ten months, sixty releases, and countless re-evaluations of the API, I am extremely proud to introduce Harp, a new kind of static web server that has built-in preprocessing. I encourage you to give it a try.
